text: Did you know why gas prices doubled? Apparently, it's because Obama opposed exploring for energy in Alaska, gave millions to Solyndra which went bankrupt, and blocked the Keystone pipeline. So, we're all paying more at the pump because of him.

Gas prices doubled because of those specific actions? I mean, gas prices fluctuate a lot based on global markets, not just domestic policy. While those are issues, attributing doubled gas prices solely to them seems, uh, too simplistic. Are you sure it's such a direct cause and effect?

That's what the American Energy Alliance claimed in a T.V. ad. They said Gas prices have doubled because Obama opposed exploring for energy in Alaska. He gave millions of tax dollars to Solyndra, which then went bankrupt. And he blocked the Keystone pipeline. So we will all pay more at the pump. It's like, a clear explanation of what happened.

I just think gas prices are a really complex issue. While those factors might play a role, global oil supply and demand, geopolitical events, and even refinery issues also have massive impacts. To say it's solely because of those three things feels like a political simplification.
